title: Adaptive Evolutionary General Intelligence System (AEGIS)
design_insight: AEGIS combines hierarchical reasoning, supervised evolutionary architecture discovery, and multi-layer safety controls, integrating dual-timescale processing, adaptive computation time, curiosity-driven behavior, and safe neural architecture search.
experimental_trigger_patterns:
Symptoms of overfitting and poor generalization
Performance bottlenecks due to static architecture
Instances of unexpected capability jumps requiring safety mechanisms
Challenges in balancing autonomy and safety in agent behaviors
background: Developed to advance AGI safety and adaptability, AEGIS leverages concepts like hierarchical reasoning models, neural architecture search, and information gap theory-driven curiosity systems.
algorithmic_innovation: The framework employs dual-timescale hierarchical reasoning for adaptive planning and execution, combines genetic algorithms with safety gates for neural architecture evolution, and integrates multi-layer safety validation including anomaly detection and auto-freeze mechanisms.
implementation_guidance:
Use adaptive computation time for solving complex tasks to allocate resources efficiently.
Implement LoRA fine-tuning for model efficiency and robustness on diverse datasets.
Integrate safe exploration mechanisms in evolution frameworks for new architecture search.
Apply validation protocols rigorously to ensure robustness and capture anomalies promptly.
design_ai_instructions:
implement: ['Hierarchical reasoning with separate planning and execution modules.', 'Anomaly detectors for real-time monitoring of AI system behavior.', 'Approval workflows for any autonomous decision-making process.']
avoid: ['Over-reliance on static models without adaptability.', 'Neglecting multi-tiered safety validation leading to undetected anomalies.', 'Allowing system to evolve without strict safety controls']
